articles.title: How Italy's Lombardy, home to Europe's 'best medical system', became the epicentre of coronavirus crisis - The Hindu
articles.description: Virologists and epidemiologists say what went wrong there will be studied for years, given how the outbreak overwhelmed a medical system long considered one of Europe’s best

articles.author: Julie Zaugg
articles.title: Meet the virus hunters who search bat caves to predict the next pandemic - CTV News
articles.description: A small team of researchers help compile an open-source library of all known animal viruses, from which scientists can forecast which strains are most likely to spill over to humans, in order to ready the world for a new pandemic like Covid-19.
articles.content:
Before entering the cave, the small team of scientists pull on hazmat suits, face masks and thick gloves to cover every inch of their skin. Contact with bat droppings or urine could expose them to some of the world's deadliest unknown viruses.

articles.title: Canada warns against use of hydroxychloroquine for coronavirus treatment - The New Indian Express
articles.description: Health Canada said that chloroquine and hydroxychloroquine were known to potentially cause liver or kidney problems, low blood sugar and nervous system problems.
articles.content:
MONTREAL: Canadian health authorities have issued a warning against the use of anti-malarial drugs chloroquine and hydroxychloroquine to treat coronavirus infections or prevent reinfections.
